modules.description: This module provides access to low-level performance counters from the Linux `perf` API, including events like CPU cycles, cache misses, branch mispredictions, and context switches. It works with `Bechamel.Measure.witness` values that represent specific performance metrics available through hardware and kernel support. Concrete use cases include profiling application performance, measuring code efficiency, and diagnosing system-level bottlenecks on Linux systems with kernel 2.6+.

This module extends performance measurement capabilities by integrating event counters from the Linux `perf` API, such as cycles, instructions, cache misses, and context switches. It works directly with `Mperf.t` values to capture low-level system metrics during benchmarking. Use it to measure and analyze specific hardware and software performance events in Linux environments where root access is available or properly configured.

This module integrates Linux `perf` API counters—such as CPU cycles, cache misses, and context switches—into performance measurements. It operates on `Bechamel.Measure.witness` and `Mperf.t` types to capture hardware and kernel-level metrics. Use it to profile application efficiency, diagnose system bottlenecks, and measure low-level performance events on Linux systems with appropriate permissions.
